entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch
entry.summary:
A complex trough embedded in a moist unstable air-mass is expected to move east across the upper North Island today. For the eastern Bay of Plenty and the far north of Gisborne there is a moderate risk of thunderstorms with heavy rain associated with the trough this evening and at night. There is also a moderate risk of Severe thunderstorms with downpours bringing hourly rainfall amounts of 25 to 40 mm.
Rainfall of this intensity can cause surface and/or flash flooding, especially about low-lying areas such as streams, rivers or narrow valleys, and may also lead to slips. Driving conditions will also be hazardous with surface flooding and poor visibility in heavy rain.

entry.summary:

For Northland, Auckland, Coromandel Peninsula the western Bay of Plenty and Rotorua there is a moderate risk of thunderstorms with heavy rain associated with the trough this afternoon and evening. There is also a moderate risk of Severe thunderstorms with downpours bringing hourly rainfall amounts of 25 to 40 mm.
Rainfall of this intensity can cause surface and/or flash flooding, especially about low-lying areas such as streams, rivers or narrow valleys, and may also lead to slips. Driving conditions will also be hazardous with surface flooding and poor visibility in heavy rain.

entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch
entry.summary: A cold unstable air-mass affects parts of the South Island today. For coastal Canterbury from the Banks Peninsula southwards, eastern Otago and Southland there is a moderate risk of thunderstorms. These storms may become Severe this afternoon and evening with hail, larger than 20mm. Large hail can cause significant damage to crops, orchards, vines, glasshouses and vehicles, as well as make driving conditions hazardous. Should severe weather approach or if you feel threatened, take shelter immediately.
